data.title: Thomas Kuhn
data.meta_description: 12min is a platform that chooses, reads and summarizes the most important non-fiction books. Start your free trial and discover a faster way of learning!
data.text: Thomas Samuel Kuhn was an American philosopher of science, historian, and physicist. He is best known today as the author of the 1962 landmark study of scientific progress, “The Structure of Scientific Revolutions.” Kuhn’s other books include “The Copernican Revolution” and “Black-Body Theory and the Quantum Discontinuity, 1894-1912.” He died from lung cancer at the age of 73, on June 17, 1996.
